conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when light source moves to back left above objects.
Current light source casts shadows to the right of objects.
Light source currently comes from the left side.
Light source moves to back left, coming from behind and left of objects.
Shadows will shift to the front right when light source moves to back left.
Shadow A will move to front right of white cloth.
Shadow B will move to front right of lamp.
Shadow C will move to front right of ring.
Shadow D will move to front right of avocado.
Shadows may become longer and more elongated as light source angle changes.
Final answer: Shadows will shift to front right and become longer and more elongated.
